reviewText: Previously, I thought that Mussolini appeared to be a bit of a baffoon during speech making. However, particularly in his earlier speeches, he shows a more reasonable and engaging, almost human side. Only later on did the baffoon appear and I suspect that his style then was the result of Hitler's influence. This is an interesting historical collection of Mussolini's speeches. With all the limitations of reproduction of sound recordings made more than half a century ago, I thought that it was a very good compilation.
